What is the purpose of the `find` command in the given script?
The purpose of the `find` command is to search for files in the specified `$DEST_FOLDER` directory that match the criteria specified, and then execute a command on those files.

# Keep only last 6 days - BE SURE to fully understand how it works, as every "rm" command!
find $DEST_FOLDER/wallet* -type f -mtime +6 -exec rm {} ;
```

(submitted by @TexWiller)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
What happens to the files that match the criteria specified by the `find` command?
The files that match the criteria specified by the `find` command are deleted using the `rm` command. This is specified by the `-exec rm {}` option.

# Keep only last 6 days - BE SURE to fully understand how it works, as every "rm" command!
find $DEST_FOLDER/wallet* -type f -mtime +6 -exec rm {} ;
```

(submitted by @TexWiller)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
Why is it important to fully understand how the `find` command works before running it?

It is important to fully understand how the `find` command works before running it because it can permanently delete files that match the specified criteria. If the command is not used correctly, it can lead to unintended file deletions, which can result in data loss.

# Keep only last 6 days - BE SURE to fully understand how it works, as every "rm" command!
find $DEST_FOLDER/wallet* -type f -mtime +6 -exec rm {} ;
```

(submitted by @TexWiller)
